tit.cmt: 「せとだいしょう」という読み方も見受けられました。（画図百鬼夜行全画集/角川ソフィア文庫）

sen.j: 瀬戸大将（せとたいしょう）は、鳥山石燕による妖怪画集『百器徒然袋』にある日本の妖怪で、陶磁器の付喪神（器物が変化した妖怪）の一種。
sen.e: Setotaisho is a Japanese specter that is introduced in "Hyakki Tsurezure Bukuro" (One hundred bags in idleness) which is a collection of specters illustrations by Sekien TORIYAMA, and it is a type of Tsukumo-gami (gods to a variety of things) of chinaware.

sen.j: 瀬戸物の寄せ集めのような妖怪が、瀬戸物の甲冑を身に着けたような姿で描かれている。
sen.e: A specter which looks like an assortment of setomono (ceramics which were originally made in the regions of Seto, Aichi Prefecture) is depicted as wearing an armor made up of setomono.

sen.j: 実際に何らかの伝承を伴う妖怪ではなく、『三国志』の登場人物である曹操と関羽の逸話をもとに、関羽をイメージした創作物として描かれたものといわれており、瀬戸物と陶磁器の2種の陶磁器の激しい勢力争いを描いたものとの説もある。
sen.e: It is not a specter that actually has a legend of some sort, but it is said to be depicted as a creation imaging Kanu, based on the analects of Sousou and Kanu who were the characters from "Sanguo Zhi" (History of the Three Kingdoms), and there is also a theory that it was depicting a struggle for power between two types of ceramics, setomono and chinaware.
